s.text: Alfonse D'Amato won approval of a provision requiring health insurance companies to cover post-mastectomy reconstructive surgery, and explains it this way: D'Amato was trying to undercut his election opponent's strong support among women voters.

Alfonse D'Amato won approval of a provision requiring health insurance companies to cover post-mastectomy reconstructive surgery, and explains it this way: D'Amato was trying to undercut his election opponent's strong support among women voters.
The NYT even goes out of its piece saying that the vote revealed a severe split in the Republican Party that may be hard to patch up.

The piece reports that in Texas, a committee of lawyers is trying to ban self-help legal software via a statute barring anyone--or anything, the paper wryly notes--from practicing law without a license.
